movie_review_blurb: One's opinion of it may depend more on age and parental status than exposure to other rock-concert films. But there's no denying the film delivers on its promise.
movie_title: Hannah Montana/Miley Cyrus: Best of Both Worlds Concert Tour (2008)

movie_review_blurb: Love and Saucers is a well-crafted, uncomplicated, accessible documentary that simply allows its subject to tell his story.
The US has five per cent of the world's population and a staggering 25 percent of its prisoners. DuVernay's film lays bare both how this has come to be and why it must change.
The earnestness of The Nun and its starlet is the source of its great charm.
It hurts to say it, but The Grandmaster might be more impactful as a series of stills than a motion picture.
Palance stands out for his villainous turn as Curly, who turns a relatively trite climax into near-Shakespearean drama.
Navajo Joe stands out for its narrative economy and visual extravagance.

mia allokoti domi tainias mesa se tainia poy diakoptetai apo alli tainia, ospoy sto telos ksehnas kai poio itan to mystiko, kai poios einai o allos poy soy to ekrybe, kai pote emfanistike aytos poy tha to mathei kai giati soy to lene esena stin teliki.
mia ap' aytes tis tainies poy den se noiazei an emfanistei enas pistolas apo to dipla gyrisma na toys gazosei oloys, arkei na teleiosei. Kai telika, kapos etsi ginetai.

o Iron Man, analafra diaskedastiko kai gargara synarpastiko prototypo eperhomenoy poly-iroa, shedon aggizontas tis eksarseis gamatosynis ton Transformers (2007) se stigmes, einai o,ti kalytero tha mporoyse na anoiksei to horo ton kalokairinon ypertheamato
Analonetai se mia monomani epideiksi toy anthropinoy ponoy kai tis mizerias stin periohi tis Indias poy ypesti tin katastrofi, hanontas ton apeiros pio endiaferon se oysia kai megethos stoho.

H panemorfi apeikonisi toy heiroteroy Londinoy tis istorias toy ap' ton Tim Burton, ap' to ena mati mpainei ki ap' to allo bgainei, prosferontas mpoliki ikanopoiisi tin ora poy ksediplonetai, alla elahista na pareis mazi soy ekso ap' tin aithoysa.

mplekei homage Kubrick kai (alimono) Spielberg me retalia Tony Scott se asmileyto stilaki Michael Bay (stise 5 kameres, peta amaksia deksia ki aristera, traba ta ola, rih' ta sti montaziera, ki opoios bgalei noima, magkia toy), kynigontas intrigkadoriko p

i tainia poy kathe skinothetis me alithini agapi gia ton kinimatografo, kanei kapoia stigmi stin kariera toy, an kai synithos poly noritera ap' oti o Smith stin prokeimeni, mono poy i diki toy erotiki eksomologisi sto sinema, ti dimioyrgia toy kai ti dyna
movie_title: Zack and Miri Make a Porno (2008)

movie_review_blurb: xoris kamia prothesi na paei ti mythologia poythena parapera, o Lucas aplos stinei ena kinimatografikis diarkeias, paidikoy prosanatolismoy epeisodio, me amfiboloy aisthitikis animation, gia na doylepsei os launching pad tis kainoyrias, senariaka aneksart
o Nicolas Cage na periferei tis ektos eleghoy sapoynoperikes toy moytes kai ti geloia malloyra toy, se ena pompodi poiitikistiko ahtarma, poy bromaei ap' opoy ki an ton piaseis

se taksideyei me aksiozileyti anesi kai finetsa, se mia eidylliaka fantasiaki ensarkosi tis endedeigmenis antidrasis ki antistasis toy anthropoy, apenanti sta mayra synnefa tis Morntor poy skepazoyn ti zoi toy
i pio anatreptiki komodia poy ehei ksepidisei ap' to aneksartito kykloma ta teleytaia hronia

aristotehniki diaheirisi mias fainomenika polymplegmenis plokis, tin opoia ksepsahnizoyn me haraktiristiki anesi kai aksiozileyti oikonomia, ksediplonontas me pliros sobaro antikataskopiko styl ap' ti skinothesia kai ti fotografia, mehri to montaz kai ti

Pathiasmeno kai filotimo skinothetiko ntempoyto, poy pashei ap' oles tis astheneies ton ntempoyton: filodoksies poy den kalyptontai ap' tis senariakes baseis kai tis skinothetikes ikanotites toy dimioyrgoy

mia astamatiti seira apo ekstatikes skines draseis ekatontadon planon ton trion (me to zori) deyterolepton, merika ap' ta opoia einai pragmatika harma eidesthai kai apo apopsi planothesias, alla kai genikoteris arhitektonikis tis horografias
i methodikotita ki i finetsa sti skinothesia, oi stakates ermineies kai to rythmiko montarisma, anoigoyn tin intrigka ap' to akros astynomiko sto sarkastiko oikogeneiako shizofreniko.

harientizomeno me amfisbitisimo goysto kai prospoiiti aythadeia me ta anomaliarika goysta tis agglikis afrokremas tis epohis, adynatei na dosei megethos sto terastion diastaseon politiko skandalo poy aggizei (oysiastika megethoys Watergate gia tin basilik

den hanei stigmi ap' ta matia toy to one-joke thema toy, kai agkomahaei mehri to telos na soy anamasisei ayta ta mikra paraksena pragmata poy mas kanoyn anthropoys ki enas eksogiinos tha ebriske paranoika

xreiazesai misi tainia, ateleioto voice over kai mia kryfi protagonistria, gia na piaseis palmo, poy apokalyptetai mono otan apokalyptei tin Penelope Cruz kai tis spithes poy petaei me to poy emfanizetai stin othoni

sti molis 85lepti diarkeia tis, na einai peripoy misi ora poly megali ki allo toso aneyri, kai s' olo to ypoloipo tis na dikaiologei tin yparksi tis se aithoysa mono os oriaka asteia, haritomeni, i diaskedastiki entelos paidika kai meta bias aksiologi na

asygkratitoi symbolismoi, poy plakonontai ap' to baros enos dyskinitoy lyrismoy kai tin emmoni se mia adieksodi kinimatografiki forma, asfyktiki ston tropo poy heirizetai ton afigimatiko rythmo san ergaleio basanistikis timorias toy theati.

sterei ston idio bathmo poy holenoyn kai oi aisthimatikodramatikes ypoplokes tis, allokota mplegmenes me lyrikes eksarseis, eskemmena hontrokommena endeiktikes tis trikymias en kranio toy dimioyrgoy me orama, poy blepei na toy to tsalakonoyn

prospathei na se peisei oti kanei tainia poy dagkonei to systima, tin ora poy o anthropos poy eihe grapsei to biblio, [...] sti metagrafi ton peristatikon toy biografimatos toy se senario, kanei ayto poy epi seira eton prospathoyse na mathei toys dimioyrg
Emfanos aposteiromenos gia to proto toy taksidi sto Hollywood, o Tom Tykwer afinei ton Frank Griebe, ton fotografo toy ap' tin epohi toy Trekse, Lola, Trekse (1998), na bgalei oli ti doyleia

Oraia tainia, na pareis agkalia ena oyiski ap' ta tsoyhtera, sto allo heri ena paketo tsigara afiltra kai na pas na ti deis, na se kaine ta tsigara opos se kaiei i mizera, na tin pnigeis sto oyiski opos pnigesai ki esy.
pashei apo ena flat senario poy stereitai klimakoseon, koryfoseon ki eksarseon kai bgainei en telei ksenerotika anepeisodiako
i kalyteri platforma gia ti sygkekrimeni tainia, tha itan na synodeyei periodika mitrotitas os anakoyfistiko sympliroma
mia parelasi ypsilon aksion paragogis, poy o skinothetis diaheirizetai me sigoyria, ntynontas se iloystrasion aksioseon, tin stereotypiki proseggisi mias stereotypikis istorias

Shedon toso aytoikanopoiitiko kai mataio, oso kai oi periodeies toy Perkins sti Latiniki Ameriki poy kalyptei o Koylogloy, horis pote na soy anoigei kamia pragmatiki porta pros to pos oramatizotan o metaniomenos gkringko oti tha ebriske tin eksileosi me t

pos tha itan to Pimp My Ride an to analambanan isobites sosiopatheis, toytestin apolaystika sadistiko kai afrena adrenaliniko
Ksanazestameno, alla akomi nostimo, to piato poy soy serbirei einai mia super sized ekdohi tis syntagis toy, me tin idia thermidiki aksia, alla horis tin geystiki apogeiosi tis neas anakalypsis

me psifiaka efe poy moiazoyn retalia tainion poy emoiazan na eihan gyristei me retalia eks arhis, den hreiazetai tin patina toy hronoy gia na ginei shedon toso geloio oso to prototypo stin apeikonisi toy foytoyrismoy toy
movie_title: The Day the Earth Stood Still (2008)

movie_review_blurb: dieisdytikotero ap' o,ti tha perimenes na prokypsei apo ena systima parakoloythisis mias pragmatikotitas poy tha perimenes na min tis aresei idiaitera na ektithetai se tetoio bathmo
den eihe kamia idiaiteri istoria na proekteinei, oyte apaitiseis kanenos fan base na ikanopoiisei, opote logika, den prospathei na kanei tipote ap' ta dyo

atafernei, an mi ti allo, na einai olokliromeni, ksekinontas apo kapoy, kserontas poy thelei na paei, pos na ftasei ekei kai giati einai simantiko na parei mazi tis sti diadromi oloys toys (polloys) deyterotritoys haraktires tis kai na toys dosei olokliro
mesa stin amerikanila tis, skoyrainei poly ta pragmata prin ta afisei na paroyn tin poreia toys pros to aisiodokso ksempoyrdoykloma toy koybarioy tis
o Baz Luhrmann htizei enan oyranoksysti apo filodoksies, pairnei to asanser gia tin taratsa kai boytaei sto keno
spatala to hrono soy pio sadistika ap' oti ta talenta ton ithopoion tis, ontas ekneyristika monotoni kai erasitehnika kryptiki horis na ehei tipote na krypsei poy na min eheis ksanadei

Epifaneiako ksysimo allis mias ekdohis tis ebraikis pligis poy prokalese i germaniki banaysotita, ayti ti fora employtismeni me eksanthropistiko erotiko proto misaoro, poy den kamoyflarei katholoy tis eksarseis symbatikotitas sto ksediploma, i tis melodra

Kakostimeni apopeira foytoyristikis klotsoperipeteias, me metaiores senariakes akrobasies, tsoyhteres eksarseis melodramatismoy, asygkratites aythairesies metafysikoy kai enohlitikes omoiotites me to Pempto Stoiheio (1997), poy dinoyn neo noima stin euro-
apsogo holigoyntiano stil komple me tileoptikizoysa eikonografisi, sympyknonontas treis romenti payla ntramenti se ena hortastiko gia ta metra toy paketo

baboyriarika poiitiko aytohaidema toy Perelman meta to House of Sand and Fog (2003), ayti ti fora dipla aforito, horis ena kapoio stori na krybetai kato ap' toys koyfioys loystrarismenoys symbolismoys toy
den katafernei na einai oyte pio romantikos, oyte pio asteios, oyte pio eksypnos ap' tis romenti poy thelei na koroidepsei kai na to paiksei anoteros

oloklirotiki adynamia ton synteleston eite na kratisoyn to pantrema sto paradosiaka apodekto, eite na to perasoyn sto prohorimeno aisthitika, os stilistika proothimeno, geionontas se akribos sto kentro enos paradoksoy yparksiakoy uncanny valley

den dikaiologei bebaia ton enthoysiasmo me ton opoio petaksan tis kilotes toys arketoi fanatikoi tis afairetikis kinimatografisis ana ton kosmo toy anaksartitoy, alla oyte prepei na perasei aparatiriti, esto kai san sporadika epityhimeni kai akribis.
mporei, ektos ap' tin agiobalentiniki diathesi, na soy ananeosei kai tin apopsi gia tis eisitirioarpahtrikes tainies

Ftini se syllipsi ki ektelesi, i pseydontantaistiki paparologia toy Bafea, dinei tin entyposi oti gyristike apo ksemorameno dimioyrgo poy pethymise na dei kana gymno gkomenaki, kai ksegymnonei ena matso apo dayta.
mi perimeneis kinimatografiki empeiria akribos, i toylahiston ohi pio kinimatografiki ap' to na hazeyeis empneysmeni logodiarroia eyrymathoys filoy kai na hahanizeis adiakritos

An kati den mporeis na tis katalogiseis pantos, einai i analithofaneia, afoy to senario ki oles oi strofes ki oi anatropes toy, moiazoyn me apomagnitofonisi ton istorion symmorfosis poy akoys stis ekpompes ton tilefonikon eksomologitrion toy mesimerioy.
apostasi toy senarioy ap' ti skinothesia pou megalonei oloena, ospoy na ftasei sto hasma poy metatrepei tis epiblitikes ki entyposiakes eikones, se epideiksiomania dihos antikrisma
Bary ki asikoto akadimaiko eikonografimeno biografiko arheio, endiaferon (ki endehomenos hristiko) apokleistika gia toys meletites toy poiiti.

katafernei telika otan den aggizei ti geloiotita, na synoreyei monaha me to filmiko aksioperiergo, ena allokoto frankenstainiko sympilima, san ayta poy eblepes me alysida kai kalathaki, sta panigyria tis epohis toy aythentikoy toy
eykoli komodia stirigmeni se tileoptika beggalika, kai olo to baros toy kosmoy rigmeno stin plysi egkefaloy tis eksantlitikis epithetikis proothisis

se peithei i eksairetika eyglotti kai lakoniki eisagogi, kai to saspens poy dimioyrgei i efarmogi toy, omos syntoma to nomoshedio hanetai se melo diakladoseis poy den fainetai na ehoyn allo skopo ap' to na paroyn amerikanistika klise kai na ta gyrisoyn an
movie_title: How to Get Rid of Others (2008)

movie_review_blurb: Eikospente hronia meta to Tron (1982), oi aderfoi Wachowski fernoyn sti megali othoni ti pio abangkarnt mplokmpasteria toy (neoy) aiona metamfiesmeni se tainia gia paidia.
alloprosalo thriler poy se stelnei arketes fores me ta atmosfairika toy kai poly apotelesmatika sta ihitika aerika toy gia kana misaoro, ki se rihnei stin ania gia allo toso

ena stoiheiotiko portraito tis skoteinis pleyras tis kynigioy tis epityhias, poy oso gigantonetai, metatrepetai sto teras tis aplistias, toso dynato poy katabrohthizei akomi kai toys pneymatikoys igetes poy tha eprepe na to katapolemisoyn

i pseytoabagkarntistiki fioritoyra poy kanei ta 77 lepta na moiazoyn 7oro, prospathei me ti dihos oysia haritomenia tis, na desei monologoys se eniaia afigisi, kai mporei na se ksegelasei otan to blepeis, alla ligo an to baleis sti seira tha akoyseis ton

i akloniti epanaliptikotita toy kai i problepsimotita stin opoia kataligei, ftiahnoyn arketa megali koilia oste ki o idios o dimioyrgos toy, poy brabeytike to 2006 me to megalo brabeio tis epitropis sto Sundance, na min einai sigoyros pos akribos na to kl
enohlitika problepsimi ki aniara kalogyalismeni romantiki komenti toy kiloy
glitonei ti mayri trypa shedon apokleistika hari sti hazomara tis synthesis tis ideas tis tainias, poy kalyptei me ena campy peplo tin asynartisia tis ektelesis
ena matso kakomoirides sernontai stin ammo kai ton ilio, s' ena ftino, proheiro, afeles kai kakogoysto deigma karampinatis gerontikis anoias toy Emmerich

soy troei miamisi ora gia na se taksidepsei sto asfales symperasma poy eihe psiliastei sto pentalepto, oti i pasifismos san haraktiristiko toy floroy, einai epilogi mi biosimi, kai to kalo gia na epikratisei, prepei na brei kako na polemisei kai na katats
it's always sad to drag a movie out to die opening against a mega-blockbuster, no matter how bad it really is
entyposiazei ap' to kalimera, me tin tehniki kai aisthitiki toy anoterotita

ena Tzak Pot sta klise poy paradoksos leitoyrgei anapanteha apotelesmatika, kyrios hari stin yperballoysa karikatoyristiki apeikonisi ton haraktiron poy se stigmes ftanei to anegkefala ksekardistiko kai sti himeia toy zeygoys ton ermineyton

endiaferon ston bathmo poy epizita to simeio kampsis tis ikanotitas mas na ksehorizoyme ti bia piso ap' tin othoni apo ti bia pantoy gyro mas, anti na prospathei na genikeysei tin dipsa gia ysterofimia poy empotizei stoys iroes toy

i katalytika akadimaiki eksistorisi toy, poy problimatizei me tin idiazoysa sadistiki tis hroia stin parathesi sokaristikon skinon bias dihos peraitero diereynisi toys, afinei to myalo soy na kykloforei kai na kanei syndeseis mono toy, me ton idio tropo p
mia ap' tis pio akompses, proheires kai hontrokommenes doyleies poy mporeis na petyheis se aithoysa

e pianei ap' ta moytra sto ksekinima toy, alla synanta arketoys boyrkoys nekron hronon kai epanalambanomenon skinon sti deyteri praksi toy, gia na anebei arketa stin triti kai na bgalei matia me merika travelling poy kremane sagonia
mono pragma poy se boithaei na pernas tin ora soy, to na metras poses gkrimatses prolabainei na kanei o anyparktos Colin Firth, hlapakiazontas kanapedakia

dyskoleyetai na kratisei ypo elegho toys melodramatismoys tis, kai sto deytero miso tis se krataei men me sfigmena ta heria ap' tin agonia, katorthoma, omos, poy den eimai sigoyros oti einai kai toso dyskolo, otan s' ehei paei os ekei me ta sagonia tentom

An kai mayrohioymoristika apolaystiko, san American Beauty (1999) se pio allegro diathesi, ta Hronia tis Mayrilas ehoyn stin ekseliksi toys mia kapoia amihania, poy se krata monimos sto ypotoniko epipedo ton hahaniton
movie_title: L'Âge des ténèbres (The Age of Ignorance) (Days of Darkness) (2007)

movie_review_blurb: miamisi ora tis megalyteris arpahtis poy ehoyn kanei pote stin kariera toys o Pacino ki o De Niro, poiitika eironiko kai righteous poy tin kanoyn mazi

o stomahi hreiazetai na to 'heis gero kai to goysto isos kai ligo diestrammeno gia tin ektimiseis, toylahiston sto epipedo poy doyleyei i ameilikti eystohia toy petyhimenoy pantrematos toy karamayroy hioymor me tin politiki satira, tin arketa sygkratimeni

Haritomeno kai akros diaskedastiko panigyri elahistopoiimenis kinimatografikotitas, me aboli skinothesia periorismenis horografikis kai allis dimioyrgikotitas, se koyrastika kleisto optiko pedio (logiko, gia na pantreyontai to miso stoyntiako plastiko yli
bazeis (ton skinotheti) se katigoria spanioy talentoy, kai toy syghoreis tin adynamia na brei kaskanter tis prokopis gia merikes apo tis apaititikes skines

atmosfairiko oso den paei, kai mperdeytiko oso den antehei, dyskoleyetai na brei to rythmo, ki asthmainei na ton kratisei, htizontas gia dyo para ligo ores tin poreia toy pros mia koyfia koryfosi, poy den apokleietai na eihes mantepsei prin kan anapseis t

ypotonikis ekdohis toy National Treasure (2004), poy aromatizetai katatonia aneksartitoy amerikanikoy, komple me to flyaro voice over gia ypokatastato tis afigisis kai liges ksekoyrdistes country hordes sti moysiki ypokroysi gia to sosto feeling

ena dioro ypertheama gemato entasi kai drasi hortastiki, apolaystiki ki aksiomnimoneyti oso tin proti fora, poy dikaionei tin katagogi tis anabionontas tin, kai kerdizei aksia mia thesi stin dipla stin thryliki trilogia tis
movie_title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull (2008)

movie_review_blurb: paramenei eksisoy, an ohi kai perissotero flyaro ap' tin pigi tis empneysis toy. Apo tin opoia krata episis to megethos ton logikon almaton, oksynontas ta opoy mporei gia na klepsei merikes eykoles fantezi tromares, eno kseperna to prototypo sto epipono t
moiazei me epeisodio diarkeias poly megalyteris apo to kalo toy, prospathei na antigrapsei olo to biblio me toys haraktires katoikon fabelas, katafeygei eykola se eykolies

mia hliara entyposiaki, minimalistiki binteoskopisi mias hliara apolaystikis synaylias, poy se fernei arketa prosopo me prosopo me ton Jagger, ton Richards kai t' alla paidia, oste na moiazei me kati poy tha mporoyse na ehei skinothetisei o Romero, kai se
kakoithis anisi pop psyhologia poy mono tis melima einai na apodosei ola ta eidi ton psyhologikon parekliseon sto proteyon honeytiri tis problimatikis shesis me ti mitera

stin Ameriki de tha 'paize stis aithoyses an i Fox den eihe ton Wolverine (2009) na erhetai (gia na kanei ta hatiria toy protagonisti toy). Se pio kathysterimenes agores (bl. Ellada) kollaei kalytera (sti premiera gia tis Mazes egine psilopatimos), kai st

ksemenei noris apo kaysimo, metatrepetai se asimanto anthropokynigito me sapoynoperarize dialeimmata, i eksereynisi ton (anti)iroon den paei kai poly makria ap' tin epifaneia, kai ta paihnidia toy Williams sta mpros-piso tis afigisis gia na soy ftiaksei s

Sokaristiko ohi gia tin tolmi ton eikonon, i ton ideon toy, alla giati katebazei ti diastimiki apithanotita toy na brethei sokolatoyho gala ston Ari, kai soy ti serbirei me ayga kai mpeikon, les kai to pio anorthodokso pragma s' ayto, einai oti to stayrol

einai akoma kalytero apo oso akoygetai, kai oti tha 'thelan na ginoyn otan megalosoyn oi shetikes prospatheies apo The Blair Witch Project (1999), mehri The Zombie Diaries (2006), Diary of the Dead (2007) i Cloverfield (2008)

Shimatiki meleti diaforon methodon fysikis kai boithoymenis gennas, poy dihos na eksereyna idiaitera kamia toys, i na entryfei stis epiptoseis kai ta proterimata / meionektimata tis mias epi tis allis, leitoyrgei perissotero san eykairia beltiosis ekforas

mia istoria skliris enilikiosis aksiosimeiota oymanistiki mesa sti moborosyni tis, kai diahroniki men, ek prooimioy de, afoy den kontraretai pote sta sobara me tin epohi stin opoia tin topothetei o skinothetis

mia ananeomeni skinothetiki proseggisi os pros tin safos mikroteri diarkeia ton paradosiakon anekdotologikon toy panarismaton kai ton tahytero, shedon kanoniko rythmo tis tainias, eno fernei toys iroes toy pio konta stin othoni, gia na tairiaksei i aposta

o Gabras soy zestainei tin kardia me maestria stin epeisodiaki afigisi, esto ki an baltonei kommataki sto proto meros, holainei kata kairoys se deyterotrites ermineies (kyrios apo Ellines ermineytes) kai problimatizei me tin anesi poy prosperna politikoin

Aniaro, argokinito kai diafano mystirio poy afinei ta stoiheia toy na peftoyn me tin diakritikotita toy elafrioy patimatos elefanta, toso kraygalea erasitehniko oso to aparadekto ntoymplarisma toy, ayto to kat' eyfimismo film mystirioy, se gemizei lypisi

ehei tis aretes tis stis protheseis tis kyrios, alla ki ena soro adynamies stin paragogi tis, poy prodidei biasyni, ap' to ntekoypaz, ti skinothesia, ti fotografia kai ton iho, os to montarisma, to hromatisma kai to miksarisma. Ola deihnoyn afosiosi, alla

o logos toy mporei na einai koyrastikos kai heimarrodis, mporei na epimenei na soy karfonei me bariopoyla sto kefali ayto poy thelei na soy pei, me rythmo kai entasi kampanarioy mes' sto kranio soy, alla toylahiston einai safis, stoheymenos kai an ohi tos

movie_title: The Angel & The Weightlifter (Arsivaristas kai o Angelos) (2008)

movie_review_blurb: Kanones bebaia poy agnooyntai, prospernioyntai, lygizontai, i spane horis kamia egnoia, otan to apaitei i formoylaiki ploki gia na ftasei stin epomeni pista mias asymmazeyta asynartitis sto desimo tis plithorikis se ypoplokes kai deyteroys haraktires isto

Molonoti me ton Lasseter kapoy pano ap' tin paragogi, na tis dinei aroma Pixar, i prototypia tis tainias tis Disney eksantleitai se merika oraia panarismata kai haritomenes gonies tainias drasis sti skinothesia, i asfaleia tis sto problepsimo senario omos

droseri, ana diastimata asteia, alla en genei filodoksi apopeira aythadeias me eynoyhismenes eilikrineis protheseis kai bretaniko flegma kommeno stis akres gia na horesei se amerikaniko kaloypi romenti, opoy niotheis synehos na leipoyn pragmata
movie_title: How to Lose Friends & Alienate People (2008)

o Zwick trabaei parapano apo ektyflotika profaneis parallilismoys tis sygkekrimenis istorias me ekeini tis Eksodoy, poy profanos den tis skeftike o Zwick monos toy, o opoios to mono poy epideiknyei synehos, einai i apithanotita toy na epinoisei otidipote

To sooy einai olo stimeno pano ston Steve Martin poy den dinei edo mia ap' tis ermineies gia tis opoies tha einai gia poly perifanos, sterontas ap' to starato boithitiko cast poy plaisionei tin omada ereyniton toy, stigmes apogeiosis

den prepei na ehoyn ksanayparksei tosoi polloi ithopoioi na paizoyn oloi toso yperbolika, se toso diaforetikes tainies kai se toso diaforetikes epohes o enas ap' ton allo, oso stoys Sklaboys sta Desma toys.
Mesa mesa sto syrfeto ton klise, an ton antekseis, ehei stigmes aprosdokita (kai abola) komikes, haritomena (kai sygkratimena) paihnidia me MILFs kai cougars kai ermineies kalodehoymena aksioprepeis

Crowe, a former Rolling Stone reporter, wastes unprecedented access to one of modern rock's most private, compelling and enigmatic acts to create little more than a promotional video for Pearl Jam's non-stop tours.
Rosi's subjects appear totally at ease with his presence.
The pitch is simple enough - liberalism or totalitarianism, heroes or vigilantes - and there's more than a whiff of American imperialism on both sides of the coin.
Whilst it arguably lacks the fresh energy of the first outing, Abrams here seems content to make minor tweaks to a winning formula, all the while keeping his sci-fi space opera accessible to all.
Refn has all but perfected his craft, so superior is it to what has come before.
A quick-witted and visually spectacular bonanza.
These supervillains are tiringly two-dimensional, with their back stories played out like cut scenes from a video game.
A considerate, weird, lingering psychological horror, The Babadook is a must-watch this Halloween.
Hosking's offerings wear thin, relentlessly attempting to sicken us with cartoon violence, excessive nudity and crass language.
Little more than a carnival of oddities, and as we have come to expect from Burton in recent years, a further example of style over substance.
movie_title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children (2016)

movie_review_blurb: A sensual, rapturous road trip that captivates from start to finish.
Ian Fleming's most famous character feels tired, dated and out of touch.
Doctor Strange is a psychedelic extravaganza that's sure to spin heads with its trippy effects and tongue-and-cheek wit.
An enchanting tale of magical mayhem.
movie_title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)

movie_review_blurb: A heart-warming tale of friendship (bringing to mind Spike Jonze's Where The Wild Things Are) loaded with ecological themes that is more robust and rousing than the 1977 original.
An immersive, visually breathtaking family adventure and a welcome addition to Disney's new spate of live-action reimaginings.
Macabre, spiteful and all too bleak in its juxtaposition of generations and their transference of guilt.
The appeal will always be there for people to revisit Hudson's award-winner in a year of both the Queen's Diamond Jubilee and the Olympics, despite perhaps being remembered a little too fondly.
Warm and charming, if hardly essential.
A contemplative, hushed tale marked with moments of violent ecstasy.
Christophe Honoré's delivers on his promises and provides a captivating film that just needs the fat trimming.
After the interesting initial concept, Electrick Children falls apart structurally, most notably in its transition between the second and third act.
Some moments will test patience due to repetitive comic stereotyping, while Zahn's performance as Frank is supremely indulgent.
movie_title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days (2012)

movie_review_blurb: A candy cane of a kids' flick which supplies a genuine sense of seasonal cheer.
In many ways this is an adult Frozen with Gothic sensibilities by way of The Lord Of The Rings, making for a derivative pastiche of the past two decades' cinematic fantasy offerings.
A straight-talking, partisan account about the failings of a broken system and a band of women who argued for better for their children.
Pure claw-your-eyes-out cinema.
If movies be the food of love, play on.
Lacks a structure that serves the narrative to the level it deserves, but Dag is certainly one to watch.
This tired mulch of fantasy clichés is hampered by its regressive attitude towards its plucky heroine.
movie_title: The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones (2013)

movie_review_blurb: Metro Manila may be rife with well-worn genre devices, but this sporadically creative thriller is bolstered by Sean Ellis's keen eye for both visceral action and relationship drama.
This curio of a character study may flounder in its second half, but the two strong leads are good for a few crude chuckles along the way.
Teen-goth fiction doesn't have to be all talking wolves and vampire babies.
Gareth Edwards has crafted the most satisfying Star Wars film since The Empire Strikes Back.
movie_title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)

movie_review_blurb: Frenzied, colourful and heart-breaking, Sean Baker's The Florida Project is a remarkable feat of filmmaking.
The film's frankness is what gives it emotional resonance, drawing us into the plight and lives of its inhabitants.
movie_title: My Life as a Zucchini (Ma vie de courgette) (2017)

movie_review_blurb: With her performance, [Rachel] Weisz shows to Clare to be much more than the doting wife: she's inventive, resourceful, and, unlike her husband, acutely aware of the reality of the situation.
Black Panther sees female characters finally given space to shine in a Marvel movie, and shining brightest of all is Letitia Wright.
Like Up before it, Coco is likely to make you shed a few tears, but here the sadness is met with joy.
There's little doubt that the success of John Madden's latest film, Miss Sloane, lays in the blisteringly chilly performance from Jessica Chastain.
There is no soul, and no heart to the story. A good sci-fi is never merely about the effects, it's about the plot, character and thoughts they bring to life, all of which Valerian lacks in abundance.
movie_title: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets (2017)

movie_review_blurb: It's an offbeat narrative, and it demands patience, but it's so worth the wait in the final moments of the film, proving to be a graceful examination of love found and lost.
A touching return that avoids sentiment but still manages to intoxicate.

You begin to wonder if the treasure is real, or is this some elaborate hoax by Fenn who is enjoying the power-trip and media attention. At one point Fenn claims, "We are all charlatans to some degree." - not exactly an encouraging statement.
Impressively, Waititi manages to retain his unique brand of humour while fulfilling his obligations to the franchise with Thor: Ragnarok.
Nearly three decades on, The Silence of the Lambs doesn't just hold up: it still startles in finesse and execution.
It goes without saying that Paddington remains as loveable as ever, but it is Hugh Grant as the dastardly villain of the piece that steals the show, offering a belly-achingly funny performance.
A nuanced, touching, humorous adventure, laced with thrilling space battles and some jaw-dropping visuals.
An empty mess, trying to please everyone; we suspect it will satisfy very few.
It is Frances McDormand who seals the deal, pulling the humour, rage and heart of this compelling - if at times difficult-to-watch - drama together.
Whatever you take from it, Mother! is a shocking delight of apocalyptic proportions.
Soderbergh has made an indie movie the way he wanted to, on his terms, and the result shows the success of this method.
This Spider-Man film is undoubtedly the funniest Marvel product since Avengers Assemble, and mercifully we don't have to go through another origins plot.
A canny blend of Heart of Darkness with the grandeur of an old Hollywood biblical epic, peppered with some intense set pieces.
movie_title: War for the Planet of the Apes (2017)

movie_review_blurb: Mangold has open-heartedly embraced the use of violence, but this is light years away from the tongue-in-cheek gore-fest of Deadpool
McQueen has not only created his finest work to date, but also a potential modern masterpiece.
A modern romantic fable with lavish visuals and wickedly entertaining performances.
The choice soundtrack, accompanied by the candyfloss aesthetic make for moments of fun, but it ultimately lacks the originality of the first.
In Alien: Covenant, the philosophising of Prometheus has been balanced with the heart-pounding thrills of Ridley Scott's original.
Skilfully crafted by director Todd Haynes, this is a film of many beautiful parts rather than a cohesive whole.
A glittering, action-packed spectacle... making you hope that more is on its way.
Loveless is a film of remarkable savagery, an astounding depiction of suffering, cruelty and indifference that lingers with the soul.
Sandler's turn is so good it could kickstart a minor comeback after his years in the wilderness.
You'll feel deeply uncomfortable while watching, but in a twistedly enjoyable way.
movie_title: The Killing of a Sacred Deer (2017)

movie_review_blurb: In its second half, the movie shifts gear into high Southern Gothic melodrama, and it is glorious to behold.

Dance sets up a charming premise and then slowly lets the air out of it over the course of 100 minutes, limping to a predictable and pat conclusion.
No doubt Roger Corman's version was worse, but it was probably more entertaining.
As a sweet comedy, it's enjoyable enough, as long as you don't expect it to carry the burden of an entire ethnic or sexual community on its shoulders.
Chocolate Factory is almost always funny and entertaining. It's just a shame that such talent has gone into a product that's so redundant.
A smart movie directed in a stupid fashion.
Instead of finding resonance between personal and political tragedy, the film only succeeds in cheapening both.
The twist is exactly what you think it is, and it pretty much invalidates any emotional investment you can work up before it arrives.
However much of this you've seen before, Abrams succeeds in making it all mean something again.
The movie is a bumpy ride at times, but, like Doris, it has its heart in the right place.
It's like an entire TV season condensed into a chaotic highlight reel, simultaneously way too long and not nearly long enough.
movie_title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice (2016)

movie_review_blurb: What once had a certain unique perspective has become just another tired brand extension with no reason to exist other than to exploit its audience's nostalgia and goodwill.

There are a handful of funny moments, but they're few and far between in a movie that never quite figures out what kind of joke it's trying to make.

Eventually, Nichols fills in enough details to make for a satisfying climax, while leaving things vague enough not to undermine the earlier ambiguity.
The tone is an awkward mix of savage jungle naturalism and cuddly animal antics, and it only confuses things further when the filmmakers throw in a couple of songs from the original movie.
After a fairly tense opening featuring Reynolds, the movie gets bogged down in an incoherent terrorism plot, along with absurdly sappy scenes of Jericho discovering human emotions.

Anyone not already familiar with his work will learn virtually nothing about one of jazz's most important figures.
Like its predecessors, Mother's Day is the movie equivalent of a bargain-bin greeting card, expressing only the most superficial, generic sentiments.
Every edit, camera movement and line of dialogue in the movie propels it toward its inevitable bloody end.

The middle-of-the-road approach is respectable, restrained and mostly dull, with plenty of biopic cliches (including the dreaded Cough of Death).
A movie that's all about adding weird little flourishes to a conventional genre story.

Consistently funny from beginning to end, even as the story eventually runs out of steam.
The occasionally amusing puns and over-talented voice cast don't compensate enough for the meager story and the haphazard morals aimed at indiscriminating children.
A sweet, low-key dramedy that is a little unfocused at times.
Often completely inscrutable, with characters behaving erratically and mysteriously.
The movie is smugly self-congratulatory in its efforts at both edginess and sentimentality, while succeeding at neither.
A cheerfully cynical romantic comedy in which the romantic lead is also the villain -- and still somehow finds her way to a happy ending.

A series of banal jump scares and pale apparitions.

movie_title: 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers Of Benghazi (2016)

A wonderfully refreshing experience.

The atheist equivalent of a VeggieTales movie.

A truncated, plodding drama with minimal excitement and nothing worthwhile to say.
Deploys just enough comedy to entice the audience while treating the true story it's based on with appropriate seriousness.
One of the most enjoyable and satisfying moviegoing experiences of the year.
Entertaining as hell, with a great performance from Gibson as an ex-con seeking redemption who can't deny his baser impulses.

Generic and forgettable, with minimal suspense and a plot that never deviates from the predictable.

movie_review_blurb: Driven by endless exposition, over-explaining tricks that aren't very impressive to begin with.

movie_title: Mother, May I Sleep with Danger? (2016)

Dull, with mediocre special effects, forgettable action and a slow-moving plot.

At this rate, the next sequel might turn out to be a genuinely good movie.
The inconsistent character development fits with the inconsistent humor in a movie that falters as often as it shines.
movie_title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates (2016)

movie_review_blurb: It's a solid summer time-passer as eager to please as an adorable dog wagging its tail.

A warm-hearted, funny, well-crafted coming-of-age story.

movie_title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl (2015)

movie_review_blurb: A funny, sad and ultimately triumphant coming-of-age story.

A marvel of action choreography.

movie_title: The 100-Year-Old Man Who Climbed Out the Window and Disappeared (2015)

It's pretty dumb, and it's predictable, and, a year from now, not many people will remember it.
All attempts at profundity are silenced by the deafening anger at the movie's core. And the deeper the film delves into its layered plot, the more ludicrous it becomes.
The jokes are fresh and more often than not manage to produce some big laughs.
While I'm sure fans will find something to appreciate, I personally found this to be the worst comedy since Adam Sandler's Grown Ups 2 and easily one of the worst of the year.
movie_title: A Million Ways to Die in the West (2014)

movie_review_blurb: Rarely have I ever had to fight so hard to hold back from sobbing uncontrollably in a theater as I did with The Fault in Our Stars.
I'd love to see a movie with these two paired up again, one that doesn't rely on cruelty to garner laughs.
While the film is easy to look at, it's not easy to watch.
If the idea of Liam Neeson being Liam Neeson-y on a plane appeals to your senses, have at it. It's not great, but you could do worse.
It's about as magical and wondrous a movie as I've seen with more laughs per minute than any movie in recent memory. The LEGO Movie is an absolute delight.
It still has a good amount of heart to it, particularly from the delightful Wiig who somehow manages to create an interesting and empathetic character out of thin material.
movie_title: The Secret Life Of Walter Mitty (2013)

movie_review_blurb: It's not their best-in fact, it hardly even feels like a Coen brothers movie at all-but its majestic musical numbers and fantastic performances elevate this well above the humdrum lesser filmmakers churn out.
Though it's not a bad movie (it is Scorsese, after all), The Wolf of Wall Street is surprisingly off-putting, overlong and morally skewed.

[Jonze's] latest, the futuristic sci-fi romance, Her, is another film of unrivaled excellence, one that taps into ideas and themes in the way only the mind of Mr. Jonze can. It is hands down the best American movie of 2013.
It's not perfect... but this is a major step up from Berg's previous travesty. This is actually quite good.
Despite a couple of legitimate laughs, it's largely unwatchable.

Some of [characters'] recklessness is so reminiscent of imbecilic television personalities that, by the end of the film's 2 hour 15 minute runtime, they can get a bit grating, which is enhanced by a story that gets progressively heavy-handed as it goes on
The idea of a RoboCop is a silly one that the original film nevertheless proved could be something more. The best thing one can say about this 2014 reboot is this: it exists.
This is the second worst of the films, rising only slightly above 2009's Revenge of the Fallen.
his is an impressive, action packed film with some terrific humor and an expectedly hokey plot that is both to its benefit and detriment.

It does just enough to work. Perhaps low expectations contributed to my overall enjoyment of it-an understandable state of mind given recent Kevin James and Adam Sandler films-and it may be slight, but Pixels is admittedly fun.
Into the Storm is a mess and with so many great films to see in theaters right now, why waste your time with it?

I'm not entirely convinced the character will mix well into the overall Marvel Cinematic Universe when he inevitably starts to crossover into other superhero films, but as a standalone adventure, "Ant-Man" is undeniably entertaining.
If you're a big fan of the first movie, prepare to be disappointed here.
Run All Night could be the worst one yet, as it simply goes through the motions without doing much of anything particularly interesting.
Into the Woods is a magical film, one that combines the natural wonder of the fairy tales it portrays with terrific songs that simultaneously poke fun of those tales and lovingly embrace them.
[Olaf] one of the most charming and hilarious Disney characters in quite some time.
Based on the classic fairy tale, but borrowing heavily from the 1950 film, Cinderella is enchanting, a wonderful and stylish film with a charming lead and emotional narrative.
It's a near-seamless concoction of onscreen surrealism that would make the likes of Terry Gilliam, Michel Gondry, and Spike Jonze green with envy.
It's not scary or interesting, the make-up and effects are subpar and the dialogue is ridiculous.
After years, decades even, of watching violence onscreen, revenge movies just don't seem to have as strong an impact. This realization is where the terrific John Wick finds its inspiration.
While the ride is a bumpy one and the destination is a bit of a letdown, getting there is a trip.

Big Hero 6, based on the comic book series of the same name lacks personality, a heartfelt story or even decent laughs. It's not a terrible movie by any means, but neither is it very good. It's just kind of there.
An occasionally sloppy script and baffling directorial decisions keep this from going very far, but if you enjoy seeing two great actors at the top of their game, you can't go wrong here.
These are dumb characters in dumb situations doing dumb things and making dumb jokes, which is the entire point.
The sparse plot nonetheless provides opportunities for a little self-reflection and some original, dark humor, making the druggy affair a worthwhile trip to the theater.
Kids don't always need primary colors and fluffy bunnies and 3-D effects. Sometimes a scrawny, ugly chameleon in the dirty Old West will do.
It's not nearly as engaging as the many films it parodies, but it's a charming little tribute.
The result is fun and thrilling, and plenty of snappy jokes and sight gags will keep audiences of all ages entertained.
It's as much a meditation as a narrative, asking a tremendous amount of patience from viewers and rewarding that patience with something entirely new.
The access boggles the mind, and some of the stories are riveting.
When the kids are happy and I get to watch a Jack Black kung fu movie, that's good enough for me.
It's a sweet tale that displays plenty of faith in humanity without ever veering into sappiness and always keeping you on the edge of your seat.
The relationship between a commoner teacher and regal student provides for enough drama, and the obstacle overcome is both inspiring and unique.
What makes Up such a satisfying film is the story of an old man deciding that he still has life left to be lived. And that life is an adventure.

Sure, there are some rearranging and compressing of scenes and facts, but the two-and-a-half hour runtime for half a book allows screenwriter Steve Kloves and director David Yates the space to faithfully retell a really good story.
movie_title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 1 (2010)

movie_review_blurb: The result is a delightful if slight tale of romance on the Riviera, an upper-middling entry into the canon of Woody Allen that will disappoint the cynics and charm those who like to let a little hope into their lives.
His qualifications for the job seem to be: 1. Having a limitless supply of money. 2. Having a side-kick that does all the work.
It's a sprawling documentary that laments what's been lost in analog recording without ignoring the benefits of technology.
One giant mess.
An elaborate production that immerses us in the opera houses and drawing rooms of Dickensian London.
Keeping the Faith lies somewhere in between the hyperreal absurdity of NYPD Blue and the boutique-chic, antiseptic Manhattan of Friends.

It repeats the formula of exclusionary representation, conceiving American history as the domain of whites, where blacks, free and slave are left on the sidelines, local color for more 'heroic' characters.
An emotionally engaging film, mainly because of Denzel Washington's award-worthy performance.
Many scenes resemble small screen dramatic reenactments, and might benefit from expository voice-over, given that it is impossible to grasp the various battles' historical significance.
Bubba Ho-Tep has everything one might expect from a movie directed by Don Coscarelli and starring Bruce Campbell
As tired as this plot may sound -- a gangster/family man sees a therapist because of his middle-age 'stress' -- Bromell imbues the premise with added dimension, raising the bar for similar stories.
We learn little about who they are beyond who Clark needs them to be: Latino punks from the ghetto who like to skate.
[Possibilities] feels more like a behind-the-scenes CD promo than a fully realized film.
Manderlay is pompously didactic from the first of its 133 long minutes -- a harsh and endlessly schematic morality tale in which diatribe is mistaken for story.
Phoenix mines a Hitchcockian vein, but it is Hoss' sensitive performance and Petzold's intelligently paced direction that makes this film shine.
If you are a fan of Gibran's work, this film is recommended for those sections, just be prepared for some schmaltz to go along with the transcendentalist philosophy.
It's a satire to be sure, but one that embraces its retro origins with an exuberance that is as much fun as it is nostalgic.
Hitman: Agent 47 is a film that bears nothing but a passing resemblance to the game that spawned it, but that shouldn't surprise anyone, as it's all just a cash grab, anyway.

The Man From U.N.C.L.E. desperately vies to be Mad Men crossed with Mission: Impossible, but it ends up being a forgettable movie that will be a diverting watch while you're, say, folding laundry or traveling internationally.
You begin to understand the eccentric characters and amazing weirdness of a (now lost) America that Blank was celebrating.
movie_title: A Poem Is A Naked Person (2015)

movie_review_blurb: Ant-Man is infectious, silly entertainment, a popcorn flick that knows what it is and does what it does to an intoxicating degree.
Accept the mission and pass the popcorn.
This is a lovingly rendered, feel-bad chamber piece chock-full of elliptical psychodrama.
I can safely say, with unequivocal authority, that you have never experienced anything like Myroslav Slaboshpytskiy's The Tribe.
For a similar and more rewarding experience, I would recommend contracting food poisoning, dropping acid, and crashing the nearest frat party.
A film not just for the musically obsessed, Don't Think I've Forgotten is a poignant and an important reminder that art matters, especially when one is facing the abyss.
movie_title: Don't Think I've Forgotten: Cambodia's Lost Rock And Roll (2015)

movie_review_blurb: Sunshine Superman is at times a bit too reverent with the material, and there are distracting reenactments (à la The Jinx and Man on Wire), some of which seem extraneous, but overall, the film is a sun-kissed tribute to a singular individual.
The filmmakers mix touching social realism, feel-good romantic comedy, and working-class farce into a patronizing ragout of flavors that never successfully blend together.

I can't say with absolute authority that The Perfect Guy is the most unimaginative stalker-boyfriend movie in recent years (I've got a lot of Lifetime movies taking up space on my DVR), but man, it sure feels that way.
This is irrelevant navel-gazing at its most tepid. Nothing (new) to see here, folks.
A ruthlessly satisfying thriller, The Keeping Room will linger with the viewer long after the credits roll.

The cast is uniformly great, and the film is elegantly shot. But when the third act reveals the film's intentions, it feels less like a procession of startling revelations and more like plot points are being crossed off a checklist.
Krisha is an exceptionally well done slow burn that ushers a striking new talent onto the film scene.
This is a look at contemporary alienation you won't soon forget.
A sad and, in the end, utterly sappy affair that recycles the same checklist of tropes that lulls audiences into thinking they are watching an edgy comedy.
Mustang is a wonderfully shot and beautifully acted (by mostly non-actors) film that spits in the face of oppressive forces while only mildly stumbling over rookie errors.
Moonwalkers blends a strange mélange of Swinging Sixties, drug-addled humor with that slow-motion, gangster gunplay that Guy Ritchie trademarked in his early work.
If Concussion had focused on Omalu's tireless efforts to expose CTE to the world, it would have been a powerful film. As it stands, it's just second-string.
Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip has sporadic laughs for the under-10 set and absolutely nothing for the poor parents sitting next to them.
movie_title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip (2015)

movie_review_blurb: While the film has about two endings too many, it's an entertaining and exciting dystopian adventure that should satisfy fans of the series. It sets a high bar for YA adaptations that doesn't look like it's going to be raised anytime soon.
Love is a maddeningly myopic film, mainly due to Murphy's squarely white-male heteronormative experience.
A drab, anemic machine, Spectre, may bring the spectacle, but it lacks a soul.
The messages delivered here are more about being a proper human than anything else, and that's a reminder we could all use.

As a reminder of the banality of evil and the way a country can conveniently "forget" its casual barbarity (did someone say Guantánamo Bay?), Labyrinth of Lies is a more chilling tale than you'll find in any horror film this season.
Knock Knock is a nasty bit of business, and fans of Roth are not likely to be disappointed. But for everyone else, the joke's on them.

The 100-Year-Old Man... still entertains for the majority of its running time, but it feels like two separate movies, a dual shaggy dog story stitched together like Frankenstein's monster, never breaking free of its quirky literary origins.
movie_title: The 100-Year-Old Man Who Climbed Out the Window and Disappeared (2015)

movie_review_blurb: A life-affirming doc if ever there was one, A Brave Heart is a litmus test for gauging compassion, one I would recommend everyone take immediately.
movie_title: A Brave Heart: The Lizzie Velasquez Story (2015)

movie_review_blurb: There are many pleasures to be found in The Connection, although they are comfortable and well-worn.
At the end of the day it's some neo-noir nonsense that makes those post-Tarantino movies from the mid-Nineties look like Chinatown.

The Salt of the Earth travels to the heart of darkness, but thankfully comes out on the other side and leaves you with a hopefulness that no matter what kind of madness and repression happen in the world, there is still hope for humanity.
It is a bland, clawless comedy; a cautionary tale of a high concept gone horribly, horribly wrong.
Le Chef isn't breaking any cinematic barriers here, but sometimes leaving the theatre with a smile on your face is haut satisfaction enough.
As harmless pablum, The Grand Seduction is mildly arousing, just don't expect it to follow through.
Elliptical, authentic, and with a strong palate of visual flair, Miss Lovely can be a confusing concoction at times, but it is never boring.
Haggis is not a subtle filmmaker. He leaves no agency for the audience, and his facile construction of this story is condescending at best.
Instead of embracing the chaotic discovery that Steadman personifies, the film ends up being merely a paint-by-numbers.
Those expecting a charming bonbon à la Midnight in Paris may wish to lower their expectations.

At a time when modern films pummel you over the head with their intentions, van Warmerdam's ambiguity in mapping out Borgman's implacable agenda will hopefully fuel many rewarding, post-screening discussions.

Carping on a film clearly targeted to 5-year-olds might seem unjust, but the filmmakers go about their business in such a lazy fashion that the viewer can't help but feel irritated by the whole ordeal.
Unfortunately, Deneuve's performance is not enough to elevate On My Way from the dredges of narrative tedium.
Coogan's comic timing has never been better, and Meaney is perfectly cast as his friend/foil. The film hums along at a brisk pace, piling one witty absurdity on top of another.
What could have been a puerile joke becomes something much more emotionally poignant in the hands of directors Bekhor and Math.
The Raid 2 doesn't so much raise the bar for action filmmaking as it pummels that bar into a mangled piece of metal that resembles nothing if not the gauntlet that's been thrown down here.
The pace and the style of E&C, not to mention its wonderful attention to detail, lift the film from being merely sweet to being something special.
To its detriment, Filth too often pulls its punches, and if you're striving for pitch black, that is most definitely a cardinal sin.
Chris Dowling's second feature at first seems anodyne enough, but once the plot mechanics kick into high gear, the film becomes as unsurprising as a prix fixe menu.
Cruel and laced with pitch-black humor, it is a film that will needle its way into your psyche; removing it may prove difficult.
The film is a welcome tonic to the cinematic landfill that gets pushed into theatres this time of year.
A third act twist renders everything null and void and seriously strains anything mildly resembling reality.
Call the shelter; this one's a keeper.
It Follows has style to burn, and the cinematography, coupled with a nuanced, synth-heavy soundtrack keeps ratcheting up the tension in smart and creative ways.

It rests quite comfortably in the realm of Greek tragedy, dealing in incest, ghosts, and devastating family secrets. It should be noted that Maps to the Stars is also supremely creepy and really funny.

It's a bondage movie without much perversion, a love story without much passion, and ultimately, a film burdened with expectations it could never fulfill. It never quite hits as hard as you want it to.
When she wins the Academy Award, I'm just going to pretend it was for Todd Haynes' 1995 masterpiece, Safe, and leave it at that.
Rich Hill attempts to lay bare these kids' lives, striving for gentle intimacy, but the result feels more like arthouse pandering.

Two Days, One Night is contemporary social realism at its finest, portraying the complicated moral landscape we're constantly navigating and the difficult decisions this modern world has invariably wrought.

Low Down is a wonderful downer of a film that fits quite comfortably on the video-store shelf between Barfly and Drugstore Cowboy. That said, depending on your proclivity for plunging into the cinematic depths of despair, your mileage may vary.
Hardcore Henry surpasses its base gimmick to become one of the most inventive and stylish action films in recent memory.
23 Blast's heart might be in the right place, but everything else seems a mish-mash of tropes hearkening back to the Hallmark movies era.
The score is suitably ominous with the requisite screeching strings and plinking piano, and the cinematography recalls early Sam Raimi.

What is most egregious, and seems completely lost on the filmmakers, is that the film is the very thing it attempts to expose: a pandering cash-in on faith-based films disguising itself as an honest examination of belief.
No Good Deed slouches toward its inevitable conclusion much like that rough beast to Bethlehem, falling apart and lacking all conviction.
My advice? Relinquish yourself to this hazy tapestry, and let the film take over. Squares need not apply.
Keating keeps his cards close, a common conceit of the films he's referencing: Repulsion, Rosemary's Baby, The Innocents, Persona, just to name a few. Does he succeed? You'd better believe it.
For the most part, Baywatch resembles a scarce amount of its origin and relies on a none-too-arch humor that misses more than it hits.
One of the most brutal, visceral films to come along in quite some time.
Another entry into another universe that no one was really asking for, but here we are nevertheless.
Amirpour's latest film is a beautiful and shambling Western, plus it has cannibalism and machine gun-wielding pregnant women.
The Book of Henry is the most misguided film since the 2003 Gary Oldman abomination Tiptoes.

Rarely do I comment on characters' hairstyles... but the decision to give Waterston a hybrid bowl-cut/Prince Valiant bob is one of the most ill-advised things this film does. And in a film that treats its audience like morons, that is saying something.
An impressively ambitious film that only stumbles into moralizing as it hits the suitably black finish line, The Dinner is an engrossing and enjoyably uncomfortable meal.
Mission Control is an absorbing doc that entertains and informs throughout.
movie_title: Mission Control: The Unsung Heroes of Apollo (2016)

movie_review_blurb: Farmers' market jokes and desert vibes hashtags aside, Ingrid Goes West cuts to the quick, ultimately revealing a toxic, yet oh-so-appealing demeanor that has come to define our current existence.
Using this moment in history, Ozon has made a quietly powerful film whose ultimate message is one of rebirth. The final shot will leave you breathless.
Nothing ever feels alive in this film. It's a couple of automatons acting out a play that was based on other plays, that was based on other plays, and so on and so forth.
Anderson, along with partner and star Milla Jovovich, have given the dwindling fans of the series a limp and lifeless simulacrum of what a Resident Evil movie looks like.
It might be one of the most cloying and aggressively irritating films that I have ever been subjected to.
Game over, man.

While Fantastic Beasts suffers from some symptoms [as other] recent high-profile Hollywood spectacles: too many set-pieces, various plotlines stitched together like a quilt, and one-note supporting roles, it is also really fun.
movie_title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)

movie_review_blurb: [Biller] is a filmmaker unlike any other working today. I just hope it doesn't take another 10 years for her to make her next one.
While Wilson the man has no filter between what he thinks and what he says, Wilson the film has opted to insert a rose-colored filter between the source material and the resulting film.
An engaging and evocative thriller/love story, The Handmaiden is ultimately a tale of freedom and transformation, as satisfying as an exquisitely choreographed four-course meal.
It's an extremely funny and caustic film, but when it tempers that with moments of humanity, that is where the film shines.
As beautiful as Loving Vincent may appear, there is nothing behind the brushstrokes.
Compadres feels less like an actual movie and more like a half-dozen movies thrown together, and absolutely nothing sticks.

This Finnish black metal comedy has its heart in the right place (severed from the body, of course, and served on a stake), but never quite transcends its quirky humor to become the epic it sets out to be.
Nostalgia feels like an incomplete reverie, an exploration of loss that doesn't have anything new to add...Don't shorten your own life by wasting it on this film.

The Fifty Shades trilogy is an incredibly inept addition to the genre, with padded scenes, no narrative spark whatsoever, and silly coincidences about Christian's troubled past that stand in for revelations that may lead to mending.
[Simon] Rumley is a talented, distinctive voice, and I can't wait to see what he does next, but Fashionista feels less like haute couture and more like prêt-à-porter (okay, I couldn't resist).
A bleakly prescient look at how the world we live in defines us, In the Fade is itself the homemade bomb of nails and fertilizer, one that will leave you shaken and stirred.
Do yourself a favor and unsubscribe.
It's a film that so confidently walks the shuriken edge of laugh-out-loud funny and cringe-inducing violence.
movie_title: I don't feel at home in this world anymore. (2017)

movie_review_blurb: Overall, Molly's Game is a crackerjack, quintessential holiday movie. Smart, engaging, and full of great performances, sometimes telling is the way to go.
Thelma is a beautiful and heartbreaking film that is an impressive addition to the coming-of-age story. A lady bird, indeed.
As overindulgent as it is, The Square is a darkly humorous and horrific mirror to our culture.
Jane is a triumph of filmmaking, and essential viewing for humans.
There are so many wonderful activities of compassion that Wiseman captures that my heart burst about a dozen times (a conservative estimate).
movie_title: Ex Libris: New York Public Library (2017)

movie_review_blurb: [Vince] Vaughn's performance is revelatory, and the film takes you on a scorching journey down a path of wicked heartlessness.
A brutally honest and caustic treatise on the meaninglessness of truth and identity in a media landscape that can only see in binary, I, Tonya starts with a cough and ends with bloody spittle.
Hosking has a keen eye for this type of cringeworthy comedy, as evidenced by every scene going on 30 seconds longer than it should, and enhanced by over-the-top, cartoony violence.
I Do ... Until I Don't never rises above the trite characters and well-worn scenarios it depicts. Best to get the annulment papers ready.
The film is another near-miss talking point in an endless deluge of reminders that this system creates a breeding ground for toxic masculinity.

The opportunity for a smart, razorlike dissection of contemporary issues falls away at every opportunity to gratuitous scenes of excessive violence that render any message or subtext completely reductive.
It's a nice bit of close-quarters cinema, offering some jolts and scares before the obligatory WTF ending.

Is it a straight-up horror movie? A mockery of artifice? Is the fact that the film traffics in nothing but artifice a mockery of that mockery? Only Refn and film grad students know for sure, but [it's] a magnificently beautiful bauble.
Central Intelligence is a throwaway film that in all the worst ways give summer movies a bad name: told by idiots, full of sound and fury, and signifying nothing but first-weekend grosses.
The only sleight of hand going on here involves your wallet.

The film is a reminder that the Internet has a good side, a connective power above and beyond the haze of ignorance and hate that seems to permeate it these days. We could probably use a little more of that reminding.

Tickled doesn't quite answer all of the questions it brings up... but it is a fascinating and disturbing descent into a particular online underworld that continues to confirm that the internet is a vast and mysterious place.
The whole thing boils down to Hioki's ego, and watching a 45-year-old musician trying to keep his band together becomes a bit taxing.
The film flirts with the substance of a delicious main course, but ends up being an annoying succession of hors d'oeuvres that never fill you up.
Reminiscent of the films of Victor Nuñez and the early works of Allison Anders, Petting Zoo is an indie that transcends whatever baggage you might associate with that word.
The Lobster packs a wicked punch, eviscerating modern romance in surprising and evocative ways.
For those up for an adventure into the LSD-influenced world of counterculture animation, Belladonna of Sadness is a curious artifact that, after 43 years, remains a glorious mind****.
You're better off picking up a controller and directing your own story.
Frenetic does not even begin to describe the film's fiery confusion.
A muddled, boring film that circles back around on itself so many times that the effect is a bit like Groundhog Day.
It's the cinematic equivalent to a carnival funhouse: a bit scary when you're traversing it, but utterly forgettable (and mildly regrettable) once it's over.
Hunt for the Wilderpeople is a thoughtful and hilarious film with nuanced performances from the two leads.
No Manches Frida tries wildly to delight but goes nowhere. It is the cinematic equivalent to the cringeworthy class clown at the back of the room that everyone ignores. It's just embarrassing.
The chemistry between the three is what makes Bad Moms rise above the mediocrity that looms in the shadow of every frame.
It's a dish with many complex flavors that may seem odd when you see it on the menu, but once you try it, you're not going back to anything else.
I'm sure there's a History Channel show that tells the tale better.
It is gorgeous animation of the highest order, a small studio firing on all cylinders, and thanks to a nuanced story, it is one of the more rewarding films of the summer, nay the year.
As a primer on a boxing [legend], Hands of Stone fits the bill, but it's not the knockout it could have been.
Greater loses its way from the get-go; you can't root for an underdog who is sleepwalking through his own movie.
A flat and tedious action film.

Klown Forever feels more like a series of events rather than a cohesive whole. That's fine with me, as I enjoy spending time with these bumbling, emasculated males grappling with their ultimate insignificance in the world.
If you are looking for something completely different, something strange, smart, and vulgar, Jensen's film more than qualifies.
Transpecos is at turns nail-biting, heart-wrenching, and suddenly ruminative.
Even with the short running time, Ghost Team slogs along for an eternity. Avoid this unfortunate misfire at all costs.
It's a powerful debut from a director who knows how to capture a moment, and convey a rabid conviction to hold on to your beliefs.

It is clear from the start that Deborah Esquenazi's film couldn't care less about aesthetics... But it becomes a compelling aesthetic of its own, expressing an intimacy with the women and their families that the viewer can't help but fall into.
movie_title: Southwest of Salem: The Story of the San Antonio Four (2016)

movie_review_blurb: A neutered, paint-by-numbers snoozefest.
The film has a restless, kinetic style that suits the drug-fueled mayhem.

Atomic Blonde is neither simple or relatable, which unfortunately keeps it being from a classic. But David Leitch's spy thriller... boasts a deceptively cunning performance from Charlize Theron, and one of the best action scenes I've seen in years.

Blair Witch uses our technological advances to its clever advantage; the characters are equipped with cameras and tracking devices. There's even a drone. Unfortunately, that's where the cleverness ends.
Song to Song is like watching a gorgeous home video of a family you don't know, and don't want to.

With its haphazard plot twists and muddy motivations, Paradox mostly takes the boring parts from Life, Alien: Covenant, Event Horizon, and Interstellar ... with a hint of one of the lesser Black Mirror episodes, and adds the word Cloverfield.

Anna and the Apocalypse has the elements of being a good horror movie (zombies!), or a good musical (songs about zombies!), or a good Christmas movie (zombie Santa!). If only it knew which one it wanted to be.
Because of Bong's technical wizardry and fondness for his characters, the titular creature's convincing CGI, and the go-for-broke cast, Okja's slapdash scrappiness routinely works.
...a cast composed of actors who are bad enough on their own, and who together amount to something unholy.
The fixated cop is a thriller cliche, but Fincher helps us understand how you could become addicted to the prospect of finding just one more clue around the next corner.
If the movie was really interested in Rae's struggle to be more than a self-loathing sex object, it would spend less time depicting her as one.
...explores how power is never really diminished - it just changes hands.
If anyone wanted to persuade vulnerable young minds to enter the maw of battle, 300 would make a heck of a recruitment video.
Godzilla lives in The Host, a South Korean monster movie that combines contemporary technique with the social commentary of those old giant lizard films from Japan.
Is New York City populated only by talky, insufferable singles who obsess over their trivial romantic entanglements?
...feels like it was concocted in some sort of hormonal haze, say maybe in the seventh month of a pregnancy.
The women in Richard's life are the problem - for him and for the film.
movie_title: I Think I Love My Wife (2007)

movie_review_blurb: ...accomplishes what many fact-based biopics fail to do. The picture gives us a sense of someone's full, lived life.
...a burly, brawny redo, like a kiddie cartoon on CGI steroids. (Isn't TMNT what Barry Bonds was accused of using?)
...honest enough not to deliver that climactic, 'breakthrough' moment.
Here's a customized way to gauge whether or not you'll enjoy Shooter: Give it three stars for each gun you own.
Even Bernie Mac ... squeezes out a tear or two. It's as if the entire cast dunked their heads in the pool between takes.
Even in its messiness, (it) at least suffers from wild ambition, not laziness. And I'd rather have a family movie go over kids' heads than insult their intelligence.
You need a perfectly timed double take to work with Will Ferrell, and Jon Heder thankfully possesses a formidable one.
...so overstuffed with heavy themes and convoluted plot lines that it barely manages to squeeze in the requisite gags about canine flatulence.
If Moses was in the theater, he'd stand up ... and demand, 'Let these people go.'
...offers plenty of film-buff fun, yet Rodriguez and Tarantino are, in a sense, limiting themselves.
The preposterousness of Disturbia increases at an alarming rate ... until you finally start losing track of all of your objections.
